thread.title: Credit Card Issuers Are Hammering You With Fees, and Some Are Worse Than Others
thread.title_full: Credit Card Issuers Are Hammering You With Fees, and Some Are Worse Than Others

title: Credit Card Issuers Are Hammering You With Fees, and Some Are Worse Than Others
text:
Credit Card Issuers Are Hammering You With Fees, and Some Are Worse Than Others Written by: Brian O'Connell 07/22/15 - 3:39 PM EDT More Headlines With Rental Rates Rising, Get Creative To Cut A Good Housing Deal 
NEW YORK (MainStreet) -- Credit card issuers love to stick consumers with fees -- and lots of them. The average number of fees on a single credit card clocks in at six, according to a new report from CreditCards.com, and some come with ten or more fees per card . According to the company's survey of 100 credit cards, the First Premier Bank credit card carries a staggering 12 fees, and only one card in the survey - the PenFed Promise Visa Card - doesn't charge any fees. Here's a list of the cards with the "most potential" fees, along with the specific number of fees on each card, according to CreditCards.com: - First Premier Bank Credit Card (12) - First Premier Bank Secured MasterCard (12) - Credit One Visa Platinum (9) - Fifth Third Bank Platinum MasterCard (9) - Navy Federal Credit Union Platinum (9) - Navy Federal Credit Union Cash Rewards (9) - Regions Visa Platinum Rewards (9) Here's a list of the cards with the "fewest potential" fees, along with the specific number of fees on each card: 1
